value.title: Architect modern applications in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to build modern applications using PaaS services for applications, caching, containers and Kubernetes in Azure.

topItems.title: Build a containerized web application with Docker
topItems.excerpt: Package a web app so that it can be deployed as a Docker image and run from an Azure Container Instance.

images.title: Build a containerized web application with Docker

topItems.title: Run Docker containers with Azure Container Instances
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to run containerized apps using Docker containers with Azure Container Instances (ACI).

images.title: Run Docker containers with Azure Container Instances

topItems.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry
topItems.excerpt: Azure Container Registry is a managed Docker registry service based on the open-source Docker Registry 2.0. Container Registry is private, hosted in Azure, and allows you to build, store, and manage images for all types of container deployments. Learn how to build and store container images with Azure Container Registry.

images.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry

topItems.title: Host a web application with Azure App service
topItems.excerpt: Azure App Service enables you to build and host web applications in the programming language of your choice without managing infrastructure. Learn how to create a website through the hosted web app platform in Azure App Service.

images.title: Host a web application with Azure App service

value.title: Introduction to Azure IoT
value.excerpt: Interested in building end to end IoT solutions or about Azure IoT, but aren't quite sure what it can do for you? This path is the place to start.

topItems.title: Enabling digital transformation
topItems.excerpt: Digital transformation is a business innovation fueled by the explosion of the cloud, artificial intelligence (AI), and the internet of things (IoT).  and allows organizations with new ways to understand and transform their business.

images.title: Enabling digital transformation

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure IoT strategy and solutions
topItems.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure IoT, and describes Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure. This knowledge can help bring IoT to life for your organization and customers.

images.title: Microsoft Azure IoT strategy and solutions

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: Assess the characteristics of Azure IoT Hub and determine scenarios when to use IoT Hub.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub

topItems.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin
topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

images.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin

value.title: Enabling digital transformation

value.title: AZ-104: Monitor and back up Azure resources
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor resources by using Azure Monitor and implement backup and recover in Azure. This learning path helps prepare you for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.excerpt: Use monitoring services on Azure to bring operational excellence to your applications and infrastructure.

images.title: Design a holistic monitoring strategy on Azure

topItems.excerpt: Evaluate monitoring options for an Azure virtual machine (VM). Enable diagnostics to get data about your VM. View VM metrics and create an alert to monitor performance.

topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Monitor logs to extract valuable information about your infrastructure from log data.

topItems.excerpt: Respond to incidents and activities in your infrastructure through alerting capabilities in Azure Monitor.

images.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure

value.title: AZ-400: Develop a Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) strategy
value.excerpt:
Learn how Site Reliability Engineering enables you to sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
topItems.excerpt: Organizations big and small have started to realize just how crucial system and application reliability is to their business. Theyâ€™ve also learned just how difficult it is to maintain that reliability while iterating at the speed demanded by the marketplace. Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is a proven approach to this challenge.

images.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

topItems.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Respond to incidents and activities in your infrastructure through alerting capabilities in Azure Monitor.

images.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure

topItems.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging
topItems.excerpt: Use application logs in Azure Web Apps to help debug web app code.

images.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging

topItems.title: Manage site reliability
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage site reliability.

images.title: Manage site reliability
Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

value.title: Connect your services together learning path
value.excerpt: Use Azure to create website front-ends, back-end services, and triggered functions that compute-on-demand and can also communicate with each other.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: When you have an application that consists of components running on different computers, servers, and mobile devices, reliable communications between those components can be difficult and unreliable. Azure provides several technologies that you can use to communicate more reliably, including Storage queues, Event Hubs, Event Grid, and Service Bus. This module shows you how to choose the best technology for your communication task.

images.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

topItems.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus
topItems.excerpt: Write C# code in a custom application that sends and receives messages using Azure Service Bus topics and queues.

images.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Implement the publish-subscribe pattern in the cloud using Azure Queue storage.

images.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage

topItems.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
topItems.excerpt: Connect sending and receiving applications with Event Hubs so you can handle extremely high loads without losing data.

images.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

value.title: Connect your services together
value.excerpt: Azure lets you create applications composed of various components: web site front-ends, back-end services, and triggered functions that perform compute-on-demand services. Azure also includes various communication strategies to let these various components pass data to each other. Learn how to leverage these communication services to create scalable, efficient solutions out of testable components.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: When you have an application that consists of components running on different computers, servers, and mobile devices, reliable communications between those components can be difficult and unreliable. Azure provides several technologies that you can use to communicate more reliably, including Storage queues, Event Hubs, Event Grid, and Service Bus. This module shows you how to choose the best technology for your communication task.

images.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage

value.title: Introduction to Kubernetes on Azure
value.excerpt: Learn about the basics of Docker containers, container orchestration with Kubernetes, and managed clusters on Azure Kubernetes Service.

topItems.title: Introduction to Docker containers
topItems.excerpt: Describes the benefits of using Docker containers as a containerization platform. Discuss the infrastructure provided by the Docker platform.

images.title: Introduction to Docker containers

topItems.title: Introduction to Kubernetes
topItems.excerpt: Determine the types of business problems that can be solved using Kubernetes. Describe the benefits of container orchestration with features like deployment management, automatic updates, and self-healing.

images.title: Introduction to Kubernetes

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Kubernetes Service
topItems.excerpt: Determine the types of business problems that can be solved using Azure Kubernetes Service. Describe the benefits of container orchestration with features like deployment management, automatic updates, and self-healing.

images.title: Introduction to Azure Kubernetes Service

topItems.title: Deploy a containerized application on Azure Kubernetes Service
topItems.excerpt: Explore how to create and deploy a containerized application using Azure Kubernetes Service using declarative manifest files.

images.title: Introduction to Docker containers

value.title: Manage security operations in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure security policies and manage security alerts with the tools and services in Azure.

topItems.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

images.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

topItems.title: Create security baselines
topItems.excerpt: Create security baselines

images.title: Create security baselines

topItems.title: Identify security threats with Azure Security Center
topItems.excerpt: In this module, youâ€™ll discover how to detect and respond to threats with Azure Security Center.

images.title: Identify security threats with Azure Security Center

topItems.excerpt: In this module, youâ€™ll use the alert capabilities of Azure Security Center to watch for and respond to threats.

value.title: Migrate application workloads and data to Azure
value.excerpt: Determine a migration approach for on-premises workloads and databases and ready those resources for migration to Microsoft Azure. Migrate on-premises Hyper-V-based application workloads and relational data to the cloud using Azure Migrate.

topItems.title: Design your migration to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Minimize the time and resources required to migrate your on-premises environment to Azure. Assess your current systems with Azure Migrate, and migrate them with Azure Site Recovery and Azure Database Migration Service.

images.title: Design your migration to Azure

topItems.title: Prepare on-premises workloads for migration to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Choose an agentless Hyper-V migration approach. Create an Azure Migrate project, enable Azure AD permissions, prepare the on-premises environment, and deploy the Azure Migrate appliance. Your on-premises workloads are now ready for the actual migration.

images.title: Prepare on-premises workloads for migration to Azure

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Enable VMs for replication by registering the Hyper-V host(s) to the Azure Migrate project. Configure Hyper-V VMs for replication, monitor, and run a test failover. After migration complete, migrated VMs should have security controls added.

images.title: Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure

topItems.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

images.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
Design your migration to Azure

topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create an Azure Cosmos DB account, database, and container built to scale as your application grows.

topItems.excerpt: You will compare the different APIs available in Azure Cosmos DB, highlighting and contrasting the different scenarios that would make them a good choice for a company.

value.excerpt: Create users in Azure Active Directory. Understand different types of groups. Create a group and add members. Manage business-to-business guest accounts.

value.excerpt: Secure your web applications on Azure and protect your apps against the most common and dangerous web application attacks.

value.excerpt: Learn how to incorporate security into your architecture design, and discover the tools that Azure provides to help you create a secure environment through all the layers of your architecture.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security

value.title: Understand the evolving world of data
value.excerpt: Learn how data systems are evolving and how the changes affect data professionals. Explore the differences between on-premises and cloud data solutions, and consider sample business cases that apply cloud technologies.

value.title: Explore core data concepts
value.excerpt: Discover how you can organize and process data, explore relational and non-relational databases, and discover how you can process data in batches or using streams.

value.excerpt: Explore two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Security and Continuous Operations.

value.title: AI edge engineer
value.excerpt: The AI edge engineer learning path takes an engineering-led approach for the deployment of AI to edge devices within the framework of the cloud. This learning path helps the participants to learn skills in AI (broadly covering machine learning and deep learning algorithms), IoT and DevOps.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT
topItems.excerpt: Explain the significance of Azure IoT and the problems it solves. Describe Azure IoT components and explain how you combine them to solve IoT solutions, which create value for enterprises.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: Assess the characteristics of Azure IoT Hub and determine scenarios when to use IoT Hub.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge
topItems.excerpt: Explain the essential characteristics of the IoT Edge and the functionality of the IoT Edge components (modules, runtime, and cloud interface). Characterize the types of problems that you can solve with IoT Edge.  Describe how the elements of IoT Edge can be combined to solve the problem of deploying IoT applications in the cloud.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge

topItems.title: Deploy a prebuilt module to the Edge device
topItems.excerpt: Deploy a pre-built temperature simulator module to the edge using a container. The pre-built module will be deployed to an IoT edge device. You will check that the module was successfully created and deployed to the edge. You will view the simulated data from the deployed module.

images.title: Deploy a prebuilt module to the Edge device
Introduction to Azure IoT
